Reviews.Title: “Don't put money before your welfare”
Reviews.Author: MrBongy
Reviews.Content: I understand everyone wants to save a few bucks, but save it on something else apart from the room. Reasons not to stay: 1) They turn away people who have booking, even those with printed ones. 2) There "safe" is a white manilla folder in an unlocked filing cabinet 3) Shared bathrooms are filthy 4) Bedrooms are so filthy you don't want to sleep 5) Obnoxious hosts who count on people not returning.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous.”
Reviews.Author: Tony W
Reviews.Content: Went there during July. Don't trust the photos. I booked through Delta Airlines website (Bad idea). Thought it would be a great place since the price was quite attractive. Heck, waste of my money. I believe the travellers photos are enough to tell you how horrible it is. Thank god I was only staying there for one night. If you do decide to stay there. Keep in mind that reservations does not equal reserved rooms. There was a family from Paris that had reserved their rooms there but ended up calling NYPD because the hotel decides to bail out last minute and say "We're full". Rooms were dirty, shared washrooms. Beds were horrible. Because we went there during the summer...It was HOT (no fan's nothing). Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - they accept more reservations than rooms they have”
Reviews.Author: Sadorek
Reviews.Content: Of course hotel is cheap and situated near metro station and southern parts of Central Park. But the rest isn't good. Rooms are big, but dirty and dark, staff is unkind. If you want to rest during NY visit - pay more at other hotel. This place is risky. Reservation system does not work good - they should fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but expect problems”
Reviews.Author: rob_sad
Reviews.Content: I've arrived in NY i late evening. In hostel reception I heard that of course I have valid confirmed reservation, but they don't have free rooms ?!? I haven't got such serious situation in much more wild countries. But this is NY - the middle of civilisation ?! Man in reception told me, that there is nobody responsible for that situation, and today it is impossible to solve the problem, so I should take myself and find any hotel as soon as I can (it wasn't easy). I returned to West Side Inn next day, they gave me back money for more expensive room in other hotel and gave me also little discount for next nights in West Side Inn. No simple word like "sorry". Next days I saw many times people on reception desk with the same problem. So I think - avoid this hostel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...BUT...”
Reviews.Author: ILOVENYCalot2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hostel the first week of August for a whole week. We never did read reviews for this one, but we read reviews for the Candy Hostel and people were saying how much better THIS ONE is compared to the Candy. So we thought we'd give it a shot. We had to make a 60 dollar deposit and when we got there, the price was a LOT higher than what the website gave us. We had a hard time finding the place and when we walked into the lobby we thought it looked alright. WRONG -the staff was very unfriendly and unhelpful -the elevator trapped us for 2 minutes....scared us to DEATH -we thought we'd have two beds...we walked into the room and just stood there with our mouths hanging open. -ONE bed. - a cheap floor fan (and it was August so it was still hot outside). - a rip off tv that only got one fuzzy new york channel. -one big mirror. -two outlets for two people who had cell phones, ipods, etc. -and we had TONS of luggage so we had to crawl over our stuff and almost broke our necks. Overall, the room was as big as a closet. There was no where to take out the trash so we had to use plastic bags and we were there for a week so it started to smell with our beyond overflowing trash. I have nightmares of that place because it had eerie lighting and spooky halls. The kitchens were discusting-bring your own kitchen gear. The bathrooms were decent surprisingly but I would recemmond bringing your own towels, bath essentials and flip flops. The window in the bathroom did not shut. The sheets and pillows seem clean BUT I wound up at Immediate Care when I got home because I either broke out from the detergent in the sheets or bed bug bites (but my friend didn't have any problems so I don't know). I only slept and took a shower (which I recommend doing in the afternoon before seeing a musical or going out for the night because no one is around) and high-tailed it out of there. This place is ALRIGHT if you plan on staying for one night but just to sleep. My friend was doing a camp so I was sight-seeing, shopping and spending time with a friend who was in a musical and dreaded coming back to the room. The location is alright. It's near the subway stop but at night it's scary. If your a college student that don't have alot of money...please try to find some place better or keep saving up for something more expensive and worth it. This place was overpriced for the crap that you get.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, but cheap..”
Reviews.Author: Ice_Angel_NL
Reviews.Content: Good points: location & price. The rest is terrible (!). Do not expect anything. Only sleep there and then get out asap. There is a really nice breakfast location just next to the closest MacDonald's btw.

Reviews.Title: “Hilariously awful -- worst hotel experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: PortCityPJ
Reviews.Content: My two nights at the West Side Inn stand out as the worst travel experience of my life. It has been a while since I stayed there, but I just stumbled across the trip advisor listing and see that apparently it has not improved. I have stayed at cheap hostels in Europe and plenty of cheap roadside motels in the US. I am REALLY not picky. But this was way beyond anything I have seen before. Every surface of the halls, bedroom, communal bathroom, and kitchen area were filthy in addition to being tiny, old, and broken down. I made the mistake of leaving my shower shoes at home, so I tied plastic grocery bags around my feet so that they didn't come in contact with anything when I was showering and getting dressed -- it was that bad. Maybe I was there on a bad day or something, but I just can't even convey how grimy everything was. There also weren't nearly enough bathrooms, so you had to fight a crowd just to get to the shower. Half the lights didn't seem to be working, so everything was just barely lit -- which I guess just helped to camouflage the dirt. I know you get what you pay for, and it was super cheap by NYC standards, but I still blame the West Side Inn for having a totally misleading web site. If you are desperate for something really cheap, then I guess maybe I can see staying there -- just know that what you're getting looks like a crack house from out of the movies.

Reviews.Title: “Great price but too many people to a below average bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: so_rich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night en route to upstate NY in late October. The bloke at reception was friendly and the hostel location wasn't bad (although I wouldn't recommend it for those who want spend all their time in down/midtown). The sheet was very thin and we were a little on the chilly side (and it was still Autumn) and the TV (which I wasn't expecting) didn't have reception for any channel, so felt like a waste of valuable space! The worst thing was the bathroom. On our floor of seven rooms (I think all private doubles or larger), there was one slightly dirty bathroom (although not the worst I've used). The water was at least hot once it got going. There was a constant queue despite us being up at 630 (confused by the clocks changing that night). At $60 total for a private room we can't complain too much, but there are better locations further south for slightly more money. Just get in the bathroom queue early and bring flip-flops!

Reviews.Title: “Do not go anywhere near that place!!! Horrible and with bedbugs.”
Reviews.Author: Mintpark
Reviews.Content: The most unbelievably jaded, unhelpful, unfriendly reception staff ("We're not paid enough to be friendly" one of them said to me; they seem to have the worst exploitative manager, 'Nick', in the universe, very sad.) Rooms are sad and the whole place is run down. Bathrooms were clean though, at least, so thanks to the certainly underpaid cleaning staff. I was eaten up badly by bedbugs in the first couple of nights and was given another room (which cost me half-a-day as I had to hang around until 2pm and move my stuff, not that they would have offered). No apology, no friendly word, no advice on how to treat my clothes and luggage, let alone a refund or laundry voucher or indeed anything helpful (various extremely friendly pharmacists, laundry workers and hardware store salespeople explained what to do to the ignorant European, lost another half day on laundering and spraying my stuff.) Don't go near the place, however tempting their prices may be. Depressing all round.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: meegs1982
Reviews.Content: Yes, the cost is very cheap for a New York hotel in such a great location. Sadly, however, that is about all this place has going for it. I stayed at the West Side Inn for two weeks, checking out over the weekend to go and stay with friends up north. Over the first week, I had very few problems. The room I was given was clean, although a little smelly, had a private toilet and sink so I only had to use the shared bathroom to shower in, and even had an air conditioner. However, on my return after the weekend, I was greeted by rude staff at the front desk, a broken elevator which meant I had to carry my suitcase up four flights of stairs to a room which was directly above the one I had been in the previous week. Considering I had paid exactly the same for the accommodation for the second week, it seemed sensible of me to assume I would get the same quality of room. Disappointingly, this was not so. The room, as mentioned, was a further flight of stairs up. It had an even greater stench than the one downstairs. The room had no air conditioner, let alone a fan during the hot New York summer. Other elements of this hotel that should be known by those planning to visit are that it advertises televisions in its rooms, but they do not work. You have to pay to use the internet on the computers provided by the hotel, but surrounding ones have free wifi that you can link into if you have a laptop with you. There are very few power outlets in the rooms to charge cameras, etc (I had to unplug the tv to do so in my second room). The thing that I disliked the most about this hotel was their check-in policy, which requires you to provide proof of transportation into the city. If, like me, you plan to leave and then return to the hotel, make sure you use public transport that provides you with a printout. Unfortunately, if you have amazing friends like me that want to pick you up and collect you from outside of the city, therefore not using public transport, you are pretty much screwed! From what I hear, there are much better hotels in New York for the same price, so give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - ever - it's horrid!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieBarley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as there was parking offered - this is actually on the street and nothing to do with the hostel so should not be used as a facility on their details. The hotel is grimy, the kitchens are horrendous, and the girl on the desk is really rude. The bathroom window on our floor was jammed open so people in other rooms can see you in the shower - nice! Luggage storage costs $5 per bag per day. I also am not sure that they charge right on taxes or if we were ripped off. It's a really nasty hostel - I'd never stay here again ever and if you do you're crazy - you'd be better off sleeping in the park. If you want somewhere for hardly anymore money you can stay at the Americana Inn, it's at about 38th street, is clean, better location and nice staff. Have fun in NY - it's fab!

Reviews.Title: “OMG, LIVING IN A CARBOARD BOX ON THE STREETS OF NYC IS BETTER THAN THIS HOSTEL”
Reviews.Author: hazel3036
Reviews.Content: Fly for 12 hours, to come to this! The pictures on this site are complete LIE! The man behind the desk had to have known that this place was awful as he asked me if we wanted to see this room before we paid. Then tells me that we are on the 5th floor and there elevator does not work and has not worked in months! It was so bad in the room that we felt unsafe, the doors are NOT secure, it is unsanitary, and and the website is completely decieiving, so bad that my husband and I took a chance and did not stay there!! STEER CLEAR, I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO MY WORST ENEMY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful place!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonUK2009
Reviews.Content: The website photos are obivously fake, the rooms are vile, the "facilities" offered in bathroom and WC are hardly what one would expect for what they charge. The worst place I have ever stayed in. Avoid this dump at all costs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for people who need a place to crash”
Reviews.Author: TexasGuy07
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place, beside the price, is the location! Very safe and nice area, right next to the subway, lots of bakeries, coffee places, restaurants and bars. The rooms are tiny, and barely have anything in them. BUT if you are coming to see NYC, and NOT spend your whole time in the room, its perfect. I stayed there twice, and everytime I would come back just to sleep. The staff is super friendly, and you meet lots of cool people all over the world. I liked it, but then again, I didnt come there to see the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't what we expected at all!”
Reviews.Author: Sammisammicool
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for a week with lastminute.com - it was a fantastic price for the overall package - and after a bit of research about this place it seemed okay. Initially when we arrive it looked okay from outside, when we entered the receptionist wasn't the friendliest & had made matters of our reservation rather confusing. We ended up in a room with a bunk instead of the double bed we had booked for. We took one look at the lift & decided we'd rather take the stairs. Being on the 3rd floor it wasn't too bad - however taking our luggage up aswell - was very tiring! We walked into our corridor & again everything seemed okay - the moment we entered the room both myself & friend were speechless. It was no bigger than a box room - again we weren't expecting much as we knew it was cheap - but we WERE expecting a bit more than what was there. The door had one lock on & didn't look very secure - the door itself had a good inch gap between the top of the door & the frame & there was one very dirty window. There was a single curtain which was just about attached to the pole, and i dont think we opened or closed it during our stay. There was 2 plug sockets [one that didnt work] a TV, & the bunk beds. I think the Tv was the only thing that kept us sane - we left it on all night so it blocked any outside noise & kept us occupied from this box we were staying in. The beds themselves did have clean sheets but only 1 single pillow which wasn't much bigger or thicker than a regular paper-back book. The matresses were also very thin so the beds weren't fantastic - however it was a place to put your head down. Our room was right next to the bathroom which had its ups and downs. As the walls are so paper thin you could hear everything going on in the corridor & the bathroom - but as we were sharing the bathroom it meant we generally didn't have to wait very long to use it. However the room was clean - so if your not fussed about size/comfiness & partially security then it was fine! The bathroom floor was ALWAYS soaking, and again was very tiny. However the toilet & bath/shower did always appear to be clean. I'm glad we never used the lift as it broke down at least 3 times during out stay. After the first few nights we began to get used to it but did move to a different hotel - which was incredible! So in the end we only stayed for 4 nights here [so the lift broke down at least 3 times in 4 days!] The lobby is the only thing thats pictured on the website i think & i'm not suprised why - it gives a very false impression to what it is really like. The internet however was very cheap $2 for 20mins i think & did work quite fast. It was about 5minute walk away from the subway - which was ideal. & wasn't that bad walking bad very late at night - however we didn't mope we did quick march back. The area itself was quite pleasant but we didnt really spend alot of time checking out what was there. Overall if you only want somewhere to put your head down - this place is fine. You get what you pay for & the location is quite good as it only takes 10mins to get to times square on the subway. However i don't think i'll be visiting this hostel again in a hurry!

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s totally fine when youÂ´re not picky!”
Reviews.Author: soyhada
Reviews.Content: the room is clean, but very simple! the staff is nice and helpful and the area is not too touristy, so you can experience the real new york and great restaurants in the area. even the bath rooms are kept clean throughout the day and in the basement you find a chillout area with a flatscreen tv, pool table and a vending machine!

Reviews.Title: “rooms are poor, but people are friendly”
Reviews.Author: CarlaWeert
Reviews.Content: We were sent here since our room at Candy Hostel (don't go there, that's really a terrible place!!!) was double booked. I don't expect anything, except for my sheets and the bathroom to be clean and this was the case. Furthermore the people are very friendly and helpfull. On our last night they even offered us to move to a much better room without any extra charge. It's cheap and quit near to a subway station which gets you to downtown Manhattan within 20 minutes, so if you are not too picky, it's an option to stay at West Side Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice town, but what about the hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Turbo5
Reviews.Content: Please, look at my homepage: [--] All was good, but the "hotel" (West Side Inn) was very simple - but cheap. In any case I was pleased with the town! Below you can find two pics showing the average standard of my hotel room...

Reviews.Title: “Hell On Earth !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovebabyboy
Reviews.Content: I love NY !!! But staying at West Side Inn was a HELL for me , I am not a princess and don't expect many luxery .I know it's cheaper than other hostels but even with this price i think it must be clean and some more comfort..if I would stay with my last trip one day longer I would be all deprest and totally nuts..... Dear people am ready for my next trip to NY and I pay some very lil more and so much better!! see here yourself GOOD LUCK! [-] N. Brussels.

Reviews.Title: “Warning:Stay Well Clear”
Reviews.Author: cmdino
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late June 08 thinking ok its not gonna be too bad , we arrived got the keys , went into the lift it looked as if we were in a submarine the door of the lift had a small window with a cage over it it took ages to get to our room once we entered our room it was meant to be a double bed but got a bunk bed (wasnt complaining since it was me and another friend who was a male ) , The room was tiny was hard to put our suitcases in cause it was that small had a small tv on the top crner of the room a window that could of easily fallen off held together by a few measly screws. The lock on the back of the door was coming off a bit because the wood it was screwed into was chipping away , we had to pull the doors towards us very tight on the outside just to get the lock even so it would lock. We understood it would be shared facilities but the cleaners didnt clean very well they had small buckets for bins with sanutary towels and stuff sticking out them , the floor was soaking and fillthy. The towels we got at reception and left them in our room once done our room never goscred for my belongings The staff were rude and werent helpful although one of the t cleaned once , thank god cause i thought i would of been robbed of my stuff. The staff were rude and unhelpful apart from one and the securty guys were cool though , Me my friend and a guy staying at the hotel heard the receptionist rip off a chinese couple of $50 , I met a few good people at this hotel the area is ok at daytime but i wouldnt walk about at night it was only a few blocks off malcolm x ave and stuff and not far off harlem STAY AWAY and pay more you will benefit from paying more

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean.”
Reviews.Author: asoasojapanapuh
Reviews.Content: I basically used this place to crash at night as I was in NYC for the weekend to party with friends at night. The bathrooms and sheets were clean and no one bothered me. So basically it was enjoyable for me. You can find a same price hostel in Chelsea but I didn't have my passport with me so most hostels were off limits (only a few, such as this one, will accept just regular ID). There's not much to do uptown if you want nightlife so I recommend Chelsea or somewhere downtown if you want a nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, overpriced, avoid”
Reviews.Author: sandersandrew
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a good, cheap hotel in New York is like trying to find a street corner at time square without some trying to get your money off you in one way or another. I booked this place because it was cheap and I was visiting in December. Admittedly the airline losing my bags didn't help, but upon arriving I thought that the lobby looked ok. My room was shabby, the shared bathroom was disgusting and there appeared to be little more than cardboard between the rooms. Best of all, my door didn't actually lock, so I spent the night with my hand luggage blocking it. This place would be far more accurately described as a youth hostel and not a particularly good one at that. It is quite handy for the subway and the upper west side is a nice quiet part of New York to stay in though.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review - Worth Reading if You've Planned on Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: photo_liv
Reviews.Content: There are a few points I'd like to make about this Hotel/Hostel: My boyfriend & I stayed here from mid-August for 3 nights. We were visiting from Los Angeles, California, and this was our first time in the city (as adults). Neither of us are very picky when it comes to living situations. After reading the reviews here, I was a bit skeptical but we figured we'd save money (and stay the rest of our vacation with friends who live in Williamsburg). We figured it'd be a lot like camping. In preparation for our stay, and based on some of the reviews, I brought our own towels and bed linens along with us. Neither of them were necessary as the ones provided were clean (although quite cheaply made). Our room was on the 5th floor. The elevator worked sporadically so it was necessary to take the stairs on a few occasions. Many of the stairs are in disrepair! While neither my boyfriend nor I have any physical disabilities, I would not recommend this hotel for people with physical handicaps as it is clearly not compliant with accessibility regulations. The room contained a bed, a chest of drawers, a television w/stand, a closet, and a big oscillating fan (which was very handy). The window opened, and heat was never an issue for us. The temperature in the room was pleasant throughout our stay. The bathrooms were a different story. Our first visit to the bathroom was a bit shocking: there was incredibly filthy toilet, and overflowing trash bin with bloody feminine products & tissues (sorry to be gross, but this is the truth). The floor was wet and a bit muddy. The smell was disgusting and akin to an outdoor toilet/portable one. (In fact, I've been in cleaner public toilets than this one!) We decided to use another floor for our trips to the bathroom -- none of which, of course were by any stretch clean or "nice". The shower pressure was low, which makes removing soap very difficult, coupled with the fact that the temperature was difficult to control. During one of my showers & a time when my boyfriend showered as well, the head/nozzle shot off! It was difficult getting it back on -- especially with water flying everywhere! The bathrooms were indeed the low point of the stay. We made it a habit to use bathroom facilities BEFORE heading back to the hotel so as to limit our use of the hotel toilets. Another matter was the smell. The hallways smelled of cat urine. It was very strong! Our room did not smell, but I had purchased perfumed candles anyway to burn while we were in the room. This was a great idea -- and I strongly recommend it! There was another issue of noise. While none of the other guest made noise, the hotel staff & workers made it nearly impossible for me to sleep! They were re-tiling the bathroom on our floor and the noise began at 7am and did not let up. The maids slammed doors & spoke loudly in the hallway. I encourage you to purchase earplugs should you choose to stay here and are a light sleeper. They came in handy for me the second & third night there. I do not regret staying here. It was very inexpensive, although there could be many improvements. My boyfriend & I now have some "great" stories to tell of this place as it was certainly memorable, and funny looking back on it. I do not think I would stay here again, but do recommend it for those who know what they are getting into. We spent little time here, and would encourage it for singles or couples who plan on sight-seeing or being away most of the day/evening hours. The location is great for walking, with a few good restaurants & grocery markets nearby -- not to mention Central Park is only a few blocks up the street. The public transportation from this location is fantastic! Subway is close by & easily accessible. I would grade this hotel a "C", mainly due to its convenience to the city. It certainly is not up to regulation both in health standards & handicap accessibility regulations, but if you know what to expect, it is great for a cheap place to spend a few nights. If anyone has watched The Great Muppet Caper, you'll find yourself humming the "Happiness Hotel" song while here ;)

Reviews.Title: “The Worst in the World EVER”
Reviews.Author: rosscollin23
Reviews.Content: The minimum rate is One star? This Hotel doesnt even deserve that. The diffrence from the Website Photos and the REALITY is SOO far is scary and I Urge ANY couples looking to stay here for the HORRIFIC price Not to. Use the New York Hostel - with Superior location and you wont be sick when you walk down the damp sweaty dark corridor to you box cell. I Cant stress enough How glad we were to get out of there and stay at the Fantastic Marrakech - just a few doors down for Â£30 less a night??? There is No comparison. Dont chance the hotel and hope you get a good experience, you wont. STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Simply awful”
Reviews.Author: yaboyhowdy
Reviews.Content: Booked online for a weekend trip to NYC to look for apartments before a cross-country move. It was listed as a two star hotel so we weren't expecting anything fancy, just a place to sleep at night after looking at apartments all day long. The location was perfect for our apartment hunting, but that turned out to be the only thing that was perfect. The lobby needs a little TLC but is gorgeous. Don't believe it. It's the only part of the hotel that looks remotely good. The rest of the building looks and feels like something out of a 70's era ghetto crime movie, with tiny rooms, cramped hallways, and decaying walls/carpets/ceilings/floors/plumbing... The first room we got smelled like something had died inside, and there was no light. After inching down a completely black hallway and turning a corner, I could vaguely make out a wire hanging from the only light fixture. Hoping it wasn't about to electrocute me, I grabbed it and pulled. I should have left the room dark. It was barely big enough to fit the bed and looked as bad as it smelled. No way were we staying in that room. To their credit, the hotel did give us a different room without any hassle. Maybe they're used to complaints about that room. The new room smelled fine, but didn't look any better, nor was it any bigger. The bed was uncomfortable and the sheets/blankets were of questionable cleanliness. The shared bathroom down the hall wasn't any better - bring sandals if you book here against the advice of all the reviews. Fortunately the weather was nice while we were there, I can only imagine how uncomfortable the hotel would be in the dead of winter or during a heat wave. I suppose it could have been a lot worse. We didn't encounter any bedbugs, cockroaches, or mice, and we were only looking for a place to sleep and bathe. Still, I've stayed in budget hotels/hostels/pensions in 3rd world countries that were far, far better than this dump. I could accept this kind of quality for maybe $10/night, but $100? Not worth it in the slightest.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: donnyenvoy
Reviews.Content: For starters there was no AC, not even a fan! The bathrooms were broke half the time, hot water was not working the other half of the time. The room was filthy, the linens were filthy , with stains and hair. The door had duck tape to cover the two inch gaping hole at the top of the door. And over all the motel was in very poor condition. Although We felt fairly safe there , I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Gross, be fair warned”
Reviews.Author: 14traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for an inexpensive place to stay for one night in NYC, we should have splurged a bit more. I booked in advance and we called 30 min. before we were going to check in, just to make sure. They were expecting us, until we arrived. The guy looked at us, took our reservation paperwork, and called another hotel to see if they had any available rooms. They didn't. So he said he had one room available w/side by side twins (we booked a double). When we asked why we couldn't have the room we booked, he just got agitated and basically said take it or leave it. We reluctantly took it, for fear of not knowing where else to go. Once we got to our room on the 5th floor, by way of an old rickety elevator, we opened the door to a tiny room with BUNK BEDS! We were not expecting to sleep in separate beds, but bunk beds was a little much. (this was the only weekend away w/o our two year old). The room was dingy and dirty, the bathroom looked like it hadn't been cleaned in quite awhile, and everything smelled like smoke. The pillows felt more like a t-shirt wadded up inside a pillow case than a pillow. When we tried to call the elevator, it only came to the 4th floor, and took us to the basement instead of the 1st. We didn't ride it again. I considered staying up all night around NYC instead of sleeping in this hotel. The only good quality about this place is that we had hot showers. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I've stayed in hostels before that were much nicer and cleaner than this.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Basic”
Reviews.Author: bosmos
Reviews.Content: The West Side Inn is okay. I have never stayed in a hostel before but this was pretty much what i expected one to be like. There were a few annoying things such as the tiny tiny tiny room - it barely fit the bed and tv (ignore their online pictures). Plus the radiator made a horrific hissing noise when we switched it on meaning that we had to switch it off for most of the 2 nights. We tried to book online but couldn't as we wanted to come the same day and so we had to pay the walk in rate which is TWICE as much as the online rate so be careful. The desk guy was nice though and let us book the second night online and not have to check out and then back in again. The desk people in general were very nice although they played loud music in the foyer through the night. The room was clean - as was the shared bathroom although I often had to wait quite a while for a shower. Overall it is worth the money as long as you book over the internet!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value (if you book online!)”
Reviews.Author: lc3708
Reviews.Content: The West Side Inn, first let it be said, is a HOSTEL and not a HOTEL. Bearing this in mind, my stay was quite enjoyable, and above all, cheap. We arrived in the afternoon, having been unable to book online for that same evening, and payed twice the price per night on the online booking system. The desk clerk was very helpful however, and suggested we book out second night online using the hostel's computers. The room was a private double, and though tiny, was about what we had expected. There was a bed with threadbare (but clean) linens, and old tv on a bizarre makeshift shelf, and a window. The window opened thank goodness, because the radiator was blasting. The tv reception was poor, but the bed was comfortable. The shared bathroom situation was not as bad as I thought, there were two to each floor (that I noticed, there may have been more) and they were kept very clean, the cleaning staff were in there each morning before 10. The location was super, very easy to find and a quick walk from the 103rd Street Subway station (on the number 1 red line train, which runs right through the heart of Manhattan to South Ferry). There were several bakeries within 2 blocks, along with a couple of pharmacies, a supermarket, a green grocer, and lots of other shops. The location was great for grabbing breakfast in the morning before heading out for the day. The hostel also has a left luggage facility, in the form of electronic lockers. These are located down the wrought iron stairs to the right of the building, and were a godsend for us before the flight home, no sense in dragging all of that luggage around. It cost $5.00 for 24 hours, but beware, you cannot reopen the lockers without having to pay another $5.00 to lock it again, we learned that the hard way. Though we were using the West Side Inn more as a cheap hotel than a hostel, it didn't seem like a fun place to stay if of itself for travelers. There was a small computer room and lounge type room by the front desk, but that was it. If you want a cozy, fun place to stay while travelling I would not recommend this hostel, but if you are more concerned about a cheap place to sleep in New York City that isn't out in the boondocks, than I would highly recommend staying at the West Side Inn. Regardless of your reason for staying though, BOOK ONLINE!!! You will pay half of what you would pay at the desk. And they only accept cash, which is annoying, though you must have a photo ID (non-NYC resident) as well as a credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Don't count on staying here even if you book!”
Reviews.Author: travelguyuk
Reviews.Content: Reading other reviews online seemed to give the impression that the West Side Inn was a good place to stay if (and only if) the only thing you were looking for was a safe place to sleep. Make no mistake about it, this was the only thing I needed and so I booked a room for myself and my partner so we could travel the 3500 miles from the UK and see the sights of New York. A not surprising amount of review space has been given to just how unorganized this hostel is. My own experience was one of booking a month in advance, emailing them immediately after booking to inform them that I would be arriving late (10pm), emailing them again a week before departure and again on the day of departure to remind them of my late arrival and still arriving at 10pm to find they had no rooms left at all. That is not to say that alternative accomodation was not provided but after 11 hours of flying, trying to find the hotel in an unfamiliar city and carrying two large suitcases I was expected to walk for 30 minutes, late at night and through uptown New York to find a hotel whose address they had scribbled onto the back of a business card. Further to this, when I finally arrived at the alternate hotel they had not received information regarding the room transfer. After booking and paying for a double room in a hostel 'steps away from' Central Park, we were given a cupboard of a room with bunk beds miles away from anything. Needless to say the pictures of the hotel are not actually of the hotel and are extremely misleading. But this doesn't matter, because like hundreds of other reviewers I never got to stay there because after taking my booking they simply gave my room away despite sending them 3 emails in advance, none of which received a reply. My advise to fellow travellers would be to book somewhere else if you want any kind of guarantee that you will have a room to sleep in when you arrive. I can only think myself lucky that one of the four hotels the receptionist at the West Side phoned had a free room for the nights we were staying as I can't imagine any assistance would have been offered had this not been the case. No apologies were offered and the casual way we were told we would 'just have to stay somewhere else' combined with the number of travellers who have had similar experiences suggests this is regular occurance at the West Side Inn. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Westside Inn is decieving.”
Reviews.Content: Hello. I stayed at the Westside "Inn" for 3 days and 2 nights in February '08. The pictures provided by this hostel are incredibly deceiving. First, the rooms are much smaller, dirtier, and worn in. We had to wait for the light to warm up before it would turn on. The communal washroom was mediocre at best. Toilet paper and warm water were scarce. The elevator in the hotel was from the Depression Era. It was faster to climb to the top floor than to wait for it to come down. We asked for a number of blankets, at which they only provided two. Please do not depend on the pictures for accuracy. You will make the same unfortunate mistake as I have.

Reviews.Title: “What is with all the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: NYCfern
Reviews.Content: Ok well basically i have jsut been on a college trip, and as most of you are now i came on here to check out the reviews for the hostel that we have been allocated to stay in! and quite frankly i wasnt looking forward to going. First of all let me just say it is a HOSTEL not a hotel. Your paying basic prices for basic accomodation. Admittingly me and my friends id have 2 of the nicer rooms but in a party of around 50 we did see alot of the rooms. They were clean, no sign of any bugs or what not. They consisted of working plugs comfy beds with clean sheets. Not all beds had thick covers so if you cant sleep with out i suggest you take a sleeping bag or something similar. The bathrooms were ok they had hot water, which was clean no brown gunk or anything like that. Other rooms consisted of just bunkbeds, but again u are paying for a bed and shelter. The only problem i foun was the tempermental lift. it tends to take u to a few floors before it takes you to the one you like but its good. It is a bit dark in the corridors but completely safe. For my idea of a hostel this was great , ecspecially for people on a tight budget. So please do take this in to consideration and do not worry about the other bad reviews that you see. unfotunatly all my pictures are on disposable cameras but i will scan and post them as soon as they have been developed.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place (to sleep)”
Reviews.Author: Nakoth
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice. My room was quite small and untidy. Also the shared bathrooms werent so great. Overall it was a place to sleep at, rather quiet and cheap! (Can only recommend to people without children.)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: cgeorgeBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: DO NOT book a room at this place!!! Without a doubt, the worst, most disgusting place I have ever stayed in. First of all, they would only take cash. Arriving very late (around 2 am due to train issues) we were told this. I went to use their ATM to get cash. There is no ATM (maybe now they have one, this was several years ago ,or maybe they now take credit?). I was instructed to go to the only thing open at that time, a local bodega. Fine, I went over and got the money. We started to go to our room and immediately our nostrils were assualted with the smell of cat urine in the hallway. A scary old lady (who I think was an actual resident here) opened her door and sneered at us as we came through. It was already like a horror movie. Then, when we got to our room I think I started to laugh/cry. First, I closed the door and the entire doorknob fell off!! Then, when we finally went to bed in the bunk beds, I looked up and my friend's was completely stained with a huge, brown explosive stain on it! Thankfully, I don't know what it was but we can guess. Lastly, we were aware of the shared bathrooms and this was ok for a budget hotel. However, one detail of the bathrooms I couldn't believe. The shower door opened only about a foot-width. I couldn't fit my body into it, maybe a child or very skinny person could. My friend, larger than me, certainly couldn't shower either. When I used the toilet, it overflowed everywhere. Sadly, I didn't care because I was already so disgusted with this unbeliveable place!! I have stayed in cheap hotels many times and never have I come close to this nasty experience. It looks from the reviews that it hasn't improved since my visit a few years ago. I wish I had photos to show people of our experience. It is still fresh in my mind after 3.5 years. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Really worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: r_a_c_h39
Reviews.Content: After arriving after a very long walk from the subway (there is one a lot closer we soon realised!) we were actually pleasantly suprised. The reception staff where helpful, every one we met in there was of simiiar age (early 20's) and very friendly. Our other accomadation had fallen through at the last moment and we found alternative but where stuck for one night so we opted for a hostel. It was a bargain, we didnt feel comfortable with sharing a room so we paid for 4 people (there was only 2 of us) and got a large private room with 2 double beds for Â£50 for the night!!! The bathrooms were clean enough, we also had a tv and cheap internet access in the lobby. Would definetely reccomend, not a bed bug in sight!!! There is nice nearby cafes to eat in as well as a few shops and restaurants. time swuare is only a Â£7 taxi ride or the subway is a 2 minute walk and is only Â£1 each to time square!! It is obviousl not 5 star accomadation but was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: adiewithahalo
Reviews.Content: For the minimal amount that we paid, I was pleasantly surprised, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and it offered easy access to NY. when we arrived the man at reception told us he had not record of us being booked in, but did his best to help, and found us a nice double room, that as I said was adequate for what we needed, somewhere to SLEEP. thatâ€™s all we paid for, we didnâ€™t pay for the Four Seasons, and we defiantly didnâ€™t get, but what we got was sufficient, donâ€™t be put off by these horror stories! I would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “crapstone villas is better”
Reviews.Author: millo9
Reviews.Content: first of all dont ever book with this hotel or west end studios, its owned by the same people. we arrived at west end studios at about 11 o'clock at night after an extremely long day of travelling only to be told there was no rooms available for us, even though we booked in january. we was told to walk about 5 blocks away which took 15 minutes to walk in a country or area we dont know, to goto thier sister hotel, and said they wouldnt provide a lift for us but admitted it was there fault. when we arrived and checked into our room we was shocked as it was a complete hovel the decor was something out of the 50's. we had shoddy bunk beds, even though we'd booked a twin room. we asked to be moved but was told it was the only one available all week. we booked through alpha rooms, who we have used numerous times and have always been happy and satisfied, and when we rang to complain they did thier best to help us, because we explained that the phots on the website was not of what we were staying in, they informed us that the photos had been removed by the hotel, obviousley they was used to get people to book. basically its a hostel not a hotel as advertised, with hoards of foreign students staying there. new york is great though.

Reviews.Title: “The worst dive ever”
Reviews.Author: frix26
Reviews.Content: Unless this place has dramatically changed since we stayed in 2004 NEVER STAY HERE. As well as happy memories of New York we bought back with us a whole crowd of bed bugs which took 12 months to get rid of. This is place is a dump

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: MissDMJ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in New York staying here and I have to say that my experience was unlike that of most of the other reviewers on here. Firstly, it is a hostel, not hotel (despite what they may claim) and as long as you bear that in mind you should have few problems. My boyfriend and I were on a very small budget as students and $70 dollars per night per room was all we could stretch to. We were very put off staying at the West Side Inn after reading the other reviews here but we desperately wanted to visit New York and figured that we wouldn't be spending that much time in the room anyway what with all the sightseeing and shopping we had planned, so decided to risk it. And I am so glad we took that risk! We arrived in the early hours of the morning several hours later than we'd told the Inn we would so they had given our room away but they paid for us to get to another hostel nearby and we were able to return to the West Side Inn the following day, also at their expense. This was probably the most negative part of our stay with regards to the hostel. Ok so it was a bit inconvenient having to unpack stuff only to pack it all away again the next day, but we were so tired we were just glad of somewhere to stay. You do have to pay for your entire stay upfront, in cash. We asked to see our room first (and also checked out the bathrooms) to avoid paying for a week in a room we might've left the next day. I recommend you do this, they didn't seem to mind and then you can always go somewhere else if you're not satisfied. The room (212) was tiny without any storage except for 4 coathangers hanging below the TV and a table, but the bedding was clean and smelt fresh. There was a big window, the lock to the door seemed pretty good and there were no problems with noise despite being next to a bathroom. There were three bathrooms on our floor and a basic kitchen, although we didn't use this at all. The room got a bit stuffy at times but there was a big fan and we were able to open the window. It is a bit of an inconvenience having to share a bathroom but we rarely had to wait and they were quite clean with high power, hot showers. The staff were friendly enough, arranged an airport transfer with Airlink for me, which is much better value than a taxi. The location is good too, just three blocks down Broadway from the nearest subway station and only a few metres down West 107th Street from Broadway so it felt safe to walk home from subway and nearby restaurants after dark. The area is pretty busy most of the time and well lit too. And of course the North end of Central Park isn't far away either and you can walk over to museums such as the Guggenheim by crossing to the East Side of the park and then down a few blocks. There's quite a few places around for breakfast and dinner too. To be honest I'm glad we didn't pay more for somewhere nicer because it wouldn't have been worth it. There is so much more to do in New York than sit in your room watching TV that we were out all day and were only in our room to sleep. If you're on a tight budget and plan on being out and about alot then I really recommend this place! Just take the usual precautions e.g. don't leave valuables in your room, lock door at night etc and you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: tolivestofly
Reviews.Content: Just looking through this website as I book a holiday, and my memory was cast back to this dump. My God, words defy me...Ranking no. 1 upon the list of comlaints would have to be when my friends and I returned late one evening to find that travellers cheques/ Passports/ Money etc were missing from our (private, and locked) room. We spoke to the staff at the front desk, who were breathtakingly unhelpful. It was only when I said I was calling NYPD that one of them mysteriously "found" our items behind the counter. In short, they are thiefs. Amongst other highlights- live electrical wires hanging out of the walls/ ceilings, and what looked and smelt like raw sewage pumping out of the shower. Honestly, if you're on this much of a budget just find a 24 hour starbucks and load up on caffeine. Or sleep on a park bench, or in a bin. You'll leave cleaner, more refreshed, and without such a deep loathing of humanity.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: isdon_isgood2
Reviews.Content: -uncomfortable matress with no padding -there was 3 bathrooms - 2 toilets didnt flush properly and the other one's light didnt work -the shower didnt turn off properly, constantly running - people came in and fixed it and it was still broken -door doesnt shut properly, noisy -broken surtain -fell through the seat of the chair -hallways dark and smelt -website says wireless internet - no such thing -fake website photos -unhelpful staff -broken window -gaps in bathroom window, broken curtain Bottom line - find somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Hell is probably a better place than west side inn”
Reviews.Author: hasny345
Reviews.Content: People,people, people, i seriously thought i was on candid camera when i entered my room. I mean sure it's a $70 room but thinking about it i should of saved my money and slept in central park. Please don't book there, you'll do yourself a favor.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a motel in NJ and take a train to NY”
Reviews.Author: gogol80
Reviews.Content: Bottomline: DO NOT STAY HERE if you have other options! Let me try to be positive first-- This place is excellently located in the heart of the Upper West area of Manhattan. If you are visiting Columbia Univ. campus for a few days, its an excellent location. The check-in and check-out process were very simple, and were done fast. BUT... The rooms are really small. There are no electrical plug outlets in your room. Even the TV is plugged to some external socket (the power cord runs outside the room through a hole by the window). The hallways stink of smoke and are damp. I made a reservation for a two-twin-bed room for my girlfriend and her dad. When they arrived, they first gave them a room with one queen-sized bed! When they complained, they put them in a room (size about 6ft by 10ft) with pink-painted walls furnished by a two-storey twin-sized bunk bed and a non-functional TV! So, if you aren't a student who doesn't mind living in a stinky dorm room with just a bed to sleep on, this place isn't worth the money. Pay a little extra and stay in the YMCA. OR better yet, stay in Jersey City, and take the public transport to NY!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable and Clean and INEXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: Kalahariuk
Reviews.Content: I had never visited New York before, but I had read some shocking reports about West Side Inn on this very site, so I was apprehensive at best, I brought a Sleeping bag with me, scared by thoughts of grubby sheets. Well I Wish I hadn't, it just took up valuable shopping space in my bag and was unnecessary and sat unused! When I arrived I was welcomed warmly by Assan, who gave me the key to my room and assured me that he would help me in any way he could. My Room was Clean and Comfortable, and smelled great. The Shared bathrooms (of which there were two on my floor) were as clean as the guest before me had left them. They were cleaned several times a day by the friendly staff. I wasn't expecting the Hilton, But I Did Not Pay for the Hilton. I Paid for a clean comfortable room and got it. The room was basic but I wasn't in NYC to stay in a hotel room. The TV worked, but I wasn't there for the TV either. Anytime I needed to know a good place to eat, or drink, Idriss or Assan would suggest a good place, I was never disappointed. West Side Inn is 3 blocks from Central Park, On the corner of Broadway. There was a choice of two Subway Stations, 110th & Broadway or 103rd & Broadway. The Furthest of which was less than five minutes walk ! One Morning I came downstairs to be greeted by Idriss (Fluent in several languages) with a warm "Daviiiid - Hi, Have you lost anything?" they had found My digital Camera, which Like an Idiot I had lost the night before. Will I stay there again? YES !

Reviews.Title: “Safe”
Reviews.Author: ALKanbi
Reviews.Content: Nice cheap hotel..you do get some very nice friendly travellers at this hotel...1 friendly staff.(Algerian one)...rooms are too small..my size 10 shoe box is bigger....room 304... creaky heater..window open..nice friendly environment..i liked the hostel..if your on budgets & ting..go for it....safe ALK wrote this

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: humbertxingjian
Reviews.Content: I feel ripped me off. I was starting a week stay in NYC in February 2007. I am not a squeamish person and this seemed like a deal. Very cheap basic place. The problem was that the room I was given had no heat. The room was 40 degrees at the most. I had a coat on in the room!! The second room they offered was exactly the same. I offered to pay for the one night but they refused to refund me the money for the other nights. They require you to pay in full in cash upon arrival so you have little recourse. The place is very sketchy at best. Good luck if you choose to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!!!”
Reviews.Author: ra_life
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about staying here. This is the most scary disgusting place I have ever had the misfortune of staying. I booked it at very short notice for very little money. This should have been my first clue... I booked three nights, I stayed for one. I only stayed that night as I was alone with nowhere else to go. I wedged the bed behind the door before I slept. I didn't bother to try to get the money back. I just checked out in the morning and said I would NOT be coming back. EVER. I think they probably charge by the hour a lot of the time...

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: carv`12345
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel. Don't be fool by the cheap prices. The customer service is terrible. They say they do not take credit cards, but they will charge your account if they believe they have the right to do so. Do not give your credit card number!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: danielle5985
Reviews.Content: They took our credit card numbers, but then we had to pay cash when we got to the hotel anyway. Smart, because if we had used credit we'd have declined the charges immediately upon seeing the room. Actually, we couldn't see our first room. The light was out. We went back down, waited about 10 minutes for the guy to help us again, and were given another room. This time, we didn't have a light switch. I had to fumble down a narrow hallway in the dark until I found..... fish line. In the middle of the room, hanging from the lamp. The walls were falling apart, it hadn't been painted in years, the sheets were stiff and thin as paper, and we had one blanket that looked like it had been washed several hundred times before being placed upon our bed. The mattress was less than dorm quality, and the small bedside dollar store lamp had actually melted. You also share the bathroom with an entire floor. The "kitchen" is a microwave, if you're lucky to be on a floor with one. The elevator is not for those with germophobia or claustrophobia. And the internet in the lobby is something crazy like a dollar a minute and kept crashing. And no, it's not an "inn" or a "hotel." The pictures on their website are deceiving. It's a hostel in every sense, except perhaps a bit worse. Skip this and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: erictcow
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel, my wife and I were a little worried about spending 3 nights in the West Side. We had booked a quick "shopping break" to NY, and the hotel was included in the package price. Before arriving at the hotel we even looked for other places to stay in NY, but most of the hotel rooms in the city seemed to be either fully booked or in excess of $500 per night. As we knew we onyl had to stay for 3 nights we decided that we would just stau there no matter how bad it was. When we arrived at around 7:00pm after an eight hour flight from England, we were suprised at how friendly the girl on reception was. We checked in with no hassle and went straight to the room. As reported, on numerous other reports, the room was very small indeed and a little tired looking, it could certainly do with a lick of paint! The most important thing for us was that the room was very clean, we were also next door to the bathromm (which was shared with a few other rooms) and this was always very clean during our entire stay, and I don't think we ever had to wait more than a couple of minutes to use it. I presume that all the other residents were as respectful as we were, and made sure it was always left clean and tidy. The sheets and pillows on the bed are certainly a little worn, but they were clean, and could be changed every day if requested. Due to some of the reports on here, my wife and I had actually taken our own sheet and pillow cases as a precaution (we actually took a king size duvet cover, so that we could climb straight into it) The location of the hotel (which shouldn't really be called a hotel, it's more of a hostel) is absolutely fantastic, with lots of bars, coffee shops and restaranuts within a couple of minutes walk. It was really easy to get a taxi from the end of the street, straight to Times Square, 5th Avenue etc and it is only around $12-$15 each time, if you are on more of a budget, then the subway is very close by. and there are lot's of buses as well. All in all, the place was a little tired looking, but very clean, and for around Â£30 a night, we didn't really expect much better to be honest. We spoke to other people who had paid a lit more, and were staying in places no better

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: hello-everybody06
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I have ever stayed!! Only stayed 1 night because we had to because it was late at night and couldn't go looking for another hotel! We left as early in the morning as possible! Where do I start with the good comments...you can read on but there would be no point as you wouldn't find any! Where do i start with the bad...I don't know but i do know that I would be here all night so I won't write them but I think (and hope) that you get the idea.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: QueenOfTheDojang
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was awful and certainly not worth the money that you pay for it. The reception area was okay but the stairs were in need of maintenance, the corridors smelt funny and were so dark that when my friends saw the photos on my return they thought it looked worse than a prison. The room did not have half of the facilities that were advertised on the website where we booked, in fact all there was was bunk beds and a TV where most of the channels didn't work. As for the beds themselves, they were incredibly uncomfortable and there were several springs that had gone in the mattress. Every morning I woke up with fresh insect bites. The bathrooms were cleaned every day but it everything still seemed dirty and the shower didn't work very well. There was no means of preparing food so I ended up paying more for takeaways and what was supposed to be the kitchen was just a room with a sink in it. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better stay away.”
Reviews.Author: jhein
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room at the West Side for 8 days and when I arrived at the hostel, I had to pay in advance (60 USD per night). After the first night I left the place and looked for another room. They did not refund my money, but I did not care, because I just wanted to leave the place. They also offered me another room, but I did not take it. My room was just a few inches bigger the the queen size bed and there was no closet in the room. Not even a hook or any clothes hangers. Whenever I needed something, I had to put the suitecase on the bed, take my stuff out, close it and put it back beside the bed. There was nothing in the room exept a bed, a small table next to the bed and an ancient tv without remote. The room was dirty and smelly and was not renovated or painted in ages. The linen were not clean and I used one of my t-shirts to cover the pillow for the night. It was very cold, but sometime during the night, the heater started to work and it got very hot. I could not adjust the heat level, so I had to open the window. So my head was freezing and my feet were red-hot. The radiator made cracking and fizzing noise the hole night and I feared it might explode. I did not catch any sleep and had one of the worst nights of my life. When I went to the shared bathroom in the morning, I lost the urge to shower. The bathroom was dirty and cold and there was just a basin, a shower and a toilet. Nothing to put your stuff like a rack or a shelf. No even a hook to hang the towel. When I went back to my room to get a plastic bag to lay my towel onto, somebody else went into the bathroom and both bathrooms on my floor were taken for at least 40 minutes. This was the moment when I decided to get a new hotel. The West Side Inn is very cheap and I expected no luxury or even comfort at all. But I expected at least a clean room and a bathroom that deserves the name. What I got was a dirty room, no sleep at all and a filthy bathroom. A friend of mine stayed at the "Jazz on the Park" Hostel at the same time and I could look at his room. It had no comfort either, but it was clean and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Kastchei
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly long review. In short, this is easily and by far the worst hotel I have ever seen. Believe all the horrible reviews. Since checking out after 2 nights of an intended 4 night stay, I have read a lot of the other reviews on this hotel. My experience with 2 different rooms is the similar as all the horrible reviews on this website. The place was easily the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Upon check-in, I was given a room on the first floor right by the entrance. Being exhausted from travel, I attempted to nap; however, the noise from the street (to be expected) kept me awake. I asked for a different room, and the noise was much less. In both rooms, the doors were very old and not fit properly on their hinges. They were painted over numerous times without sanding so that they were easily a half inch thicker. The doors in both rooms and to the bathrooms did not close completely and had to be secured with bars, whose screws were almost pulled out of the door. The two rooms I stayed at look absolutely nothing like the pictures on the hotel's website or on the pictures on hotel.com as of September, 2006. The only items in the room were a double bed, 2 stained towels, 2 hotel bars of soap, a fan, and a small TV. There was no remote, no phone, no night stand, no shampoo. There was no air conditioning and no closable window. The thin curtain was stained and worn. The walls were painted over as many times as the doors. There was no proper ceiling, instead just the exposed cement of the next floor above. There were exposed pipes in the one corner and across the ceiling. There was no lamp, instead only a flickering florescent light which took a minute or two to light. No cute pictures on teh wall or plants on a night stand. There was no clock or radio. The bed was wrapped in a plastic covering making it very uncomfortable; the pillows were lumpy. The sheets were stained, whether by rust, urine, or post-coital fluids I do not know. The sheets were worn thin. The comforter was way too heavy for summer without AC. The window was stuck open, and strange odors wafted in from time to time, almost like cigar smoke, yet impossible since the second room faced into another building. The bathroom floors were uneven such that the door had a 3 inch gap on the one side along the bottom. The shower doors were hard to slide open and closed. For being "immaculately cleaned twice a day" the bathrooms were quite dirty. The water pressure was unsteady, forcing me to constantly change the amount of hot and cold. Luckily, I did not have a problem with drainage. The toilet actually was clean, and there was always toilet paper. The bathrooms were painted bright yellow, not a cheery soft yellow, but a vibrant, bright yellow, a shade that I never thought existed in paint. The paint was new, but obviously painted over chipped and cracked layers. There were constantly puddles of water on the floor. The one toilet leaked. The steps upstairs were cracked and one had been replaced by a textured steel plate. There are some positives. Unlike some of the reviews, I saw no vermin. I was surprised not to at least get bitten by mosquitos considering the window was stuck open. Additionally, the neighboorhood is not bad at all. It's high in the upper west side, almost to morningside heights, but it was convenient to the subway and near some very good restaurants. Some of the apartments nearby looked very nice. Contrary to some reviews, there were no thugs, prostitutes, or loud partiers around. This hotel seems to be perhaps one of the last buildings in the area that has not been renovated completely. If there are indeed some rooms which look like the advertised pictures, they are not on either the first nor second floor. You could ask for a higher floor, but why would you want to leave that up to chance? Supposedly, they were full otherwise. I could not take the place. I was in town to find an apartment for a relocation. Luckily, I found someplace my second day, and so I checked out two days early and rented a car to drive back home. I am in the process of getting a refund from hotels.com for the two days I did not stay there. I have stayed in some bad hotels, and NYC is my favorite city, and yet I could not bare to spend another night in this place, even meaning that I would have to return home sooner. If you can at all afford more, try Hotel 31. It is the same set up (small rooms, shared bathrooms), but a much higher quality in an even more convenient neighborhood (Midtown, 31st). I stayed there back in April for the same price as West Side Inn and only chose West Side Inn this time because Hotel 31 had gone up $20 (probably seasonal). Trust me, get a cheaper dinner or have fewer drinks or take the subway instead of a cab or something to save an extra $20 and stay there or someplace else. Really, I cannot image someplace worse. Upon waking up sweaty the one morning, I looked at my friend and remarked that I felt like I was in a movie where I was holed up somewhere on the lam. Seriously think of those movies where the guy is holed up in a stinky, dingy, dark, humid hole in the wall; that's West Side Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful but be prepared”
Reviews.Author: DK1bunny
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a 4 month old baby!! This hotel is really cheap, but you are ONLY getting what you pay for. A big plus - ZERO infestation - which was really important with an infant and quite rare in cheap accomodation in NYC. We got a high up floor which was nice as you got a cool breeze and could leave the window open - very important as they have no AC. Take flip flops as the bathroom is often flooded, and a long robe as it can be quite a walk from the room to the bathroom. It is worth investigating the kitchens on each floor as even though your floor might not have a microwave or a cooker, other floors do. This place is absolutely great if all you need is a door that locks and a bed that is [relatively] stable. Sheets and towels were clean and fresh, bathroom is cleaned regularly. Be careful on the stairs as some of the boards have been replaced quite poorly and feel as if they might give way. The clientele is 'interesting', some are permenant residents [you can tell by whether they have a doormat outside the door], we had the dubious pleasure of listening to a very messy breakup of a couple on the same floor, but they did politely stop screaming at each other and throwing belongings into the hallway to let me get past with the baby. Stay, save your money for enjoying the life of NYC, that's what you came for after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My honest opinion is that this is a great place to stay when on a budget. I stayed over the Memorial Day weekend, only about Â£40 (about $80) for a private room for two - which included a queen size bed AND bunks - plenty of room to move. I thought it was quite clean, even the shared bathrooms, they seemed to be cleaned quite regularly. It was my first time to New York and I thought the West Side Inn was in a great location, lots of resturants nearby, a short stroll to Central Park, and close to Subways. The staff were very friendly to us - said hi each time we went in and out. There are also locker facilities in the basement which was great. I also found this wasn't all a 'youth' hostel -a mixed range of guests, young and old. Obviously some of the other reviewers must have been expecting a bit more...I mean of course it's not the Hilton but I found this place a great, cheap stay and would not hesitate to return and recommend! Terrific value for money!

Reviews.Title: “fun and affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i was in town for a conference at columbia and some friends and i booked a room at the wsi for 3 nights. we arrived, i immediately met some of the nicest people i have ever met. we sat around on the front steps somking and talking for hours and hours. i never felt unsafe in the neighborhood or in the rooms. have a sense of humor people. obviously, if money wasn't an issue most people would stay someplace where the doors closed all the way and the elevators worked all the time, but i wouldn't . i met a lot of international kids who will be staying at my house when they come to chicago. the manager was nice and funny. all i did was stumble up to the room and go to sleep and wake up and leave, i didn't need a fancy hotel. it's a great place to stay. i plan on staying there next time i go to new york

Reviews.Title: “What a hole!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was terrible! I have stayed in countless hostels and none as badly kept as this! Our room had cockroach's everywhere, the bed was tiny, it smelt and looked like a prison cell. I would like anyone doubting my tolerance to bare in mind that i have just spent 3 months backpacking through India and saw nowhere this bad over there! The bathroom was awful and whilst we were there it seemed that no one was capable of putting their used toilet paper in the actual toilet....... I would implore anyone to stay at the YMCA instead, also on the upper west side but a lot cleaner than this hole!

Reviews.Title: “Look at candid travelers photos -this is EXACTLY what you'll find-HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: k_k111
Reviews.Content: Please, please, don't stay there, even if you're on a budget. There are other budget hotels in that area, I am sure any of them will be better than West Side Inn. Look at the candid traveler's photos on this website - they are so true. This is exactly what you'll find there.... may be even worse. We were on a budget, really on a budget and did not mind staying at a less than good hotel. We were ready to be not very comfortable. We were ready for old and dirty rooms with no service at all ....We were not ready for this!!!! We felt like we didn't save anything, rather lost, cause it was so so so horrible. Don't belive the nice-looking pics of their rooms, I am sure it was taken somewhere else. Jail cells must be better than this.I am sure there are rats there and they've make all those holes in the walls and doors that are painted 10 times over with horrible brown paint. We were constantly worried that someone will come in and mug us or perhaps even kill.....

Reviews.Title: “Dont be Cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, we got stuck in the elevator for 45 minutes waiting for help, next the door knob pulled off and since there werent any other vacancy's we had to sleep in a room with no lock. There was one light bulb in the room which burned out and since no janitors were around after hours, we got changed in the dark. The 9" tv had no remote. the windows had steel bars on them. Wait it gets better. in the morning when we got upp, we found yellow urine stains all over the top bunks sheets. and on the way out this hell hole i saw a used condom next to the bed post and roaches next to it. I raised hell down at the lobby and the immigrants that didnt speak english had no comment. spent an extra $20 and go to a motel uptown

Reviews.Title: “cheap but dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights it was very cheap $80 a night for a private room. If you are on a budget it fine but i would be prepared before going. I took my own sheets and my own towels plus some air freshners and a pair of flip flops because the bath looks like someone just washed their dog in it. But if like us you really only want somewhere to lay your head and be under $100 then this is your place and also make sure you have a copy of your booking as they lost ours but i had my own.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews before booking!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at this hotel in spring time. It's a very cheap hotel in NYC, so you get what you pay (do not expect something better for that price in that city!!). The staff was helpful, but the elevator was broken (the stair case is very narrow!). The rooms were clean, "colorful", but smell horribly (they hardly resembled the ones promoted in their web site). The bathroom was clean and usable. The closest subway stations are located in 103th St. and 110th St.. During day time it is a safe neighborhood, so it is possible to walk to everything close or to take the subway. In spring/summer time you can walk your way back until app. 9,00 PM. During night time, you better take a cab from the subway. Maybe good for exchange students or explorers in their trip "around the world", but unadvisable for people or couples expecting to have the best time of their lives in NYC. Would I return again? I do not think so! (I already satisfied my curiosity with this hotel)

Reviews.Title: “neiither bad nor great, but does the trick”
Reviews.Author: 4familytravels
Reviews.Content: this is a safe place to stay, or rather sleep. room is small, but clean, rooms are not the best, brightest, but clean and comfortable. no amenities, but what do you expect from a hostel. Bathrooms are clean or at least were clean when we used them. we stayed for 5 nights, and spend only early mornings and nights in our room, and it was more than sufficient. i suspect they have many different kinds of rooms and some are better than others - judging by reviews, but our room was just fine. We found an 85 dollar rate on their website --- and were more than happy, because the lowest priced hotel with a private bathroom for our stay was well over $200, but i guess that is the going rate for new york.

Reviews.Title: “WSI - Why WSI -Where WSI - Who WSI - What WSI”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well let me tell you about the WSI Hotel. What an experience. Lots of people say WSI Scam WSI Scam WSI Scam. I like the hotel. Sure it is not pretty. But Certainly not a WSI Scam in my humble opinion. I really enjoyed the WSI service and the support that we had at the door. WSI gave me alot of confidence from the beginning. OK WSI is not a pretty hotel... I will give you that but not a Scam in my opinion. Value for sevice and price. WSI met my expectations and they were not a SCAM. No not on your life. WSI gave me the service i desrved at the right WSI Price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It........ :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the second we arrived we were treated like lost family, the hostel was clean, comfortable and the staff was great...... We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Scary! - Website Misleads - not even worth 25$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: BRUTAL! called three time before answering phone then told me i had to prebook through website night clerk sitting ON desk cross-legged with no shoes on and half eating plate of food beside would nor provide receipt could see into room from hallwall through crack in door. stained threadbare sheets on thin plastic covered matress no furniture bare single flourescent light bulb in ceiling noise through walls shared bathroom very dirty no hot water

Reviews.Title: “Bring home humorous anecdotes and mild skin diseases”
Reviews.Author: road_tripper4
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other posters in that people shouldn't expect too much from a place that charges such outrageously low prices, but there are some basic standards that should be lived up to. My friend and I didn't have an issue with the staff; we checked in and out hassle-free. The lobby is a little misleading. Gold paint, chandeliers, and leather seats make you assume the rest of the place looks like that. Wrong! Our room was on the 6th floor, and we were casually informed that the elevator didn't go to the 6th floor...it stopped at the 5th. This wouldn't be such a hassle if we didn't have tons of luggage to drag up the narrow, dim stairwell. The first thing we noticed about our room was the door. It had been painted over so many times that the doorknob and doorjam were nonfunctioning. It was locked with a deadbolt and had to be pushed open. When we walked in, we were immediately assaulted with the pungent odor of cat urine. It was a little bizarre, as there were no cats in sight (we hope). We got used to the smell eventually, but each time we came back to the room after a night out it hit us all over again. The sink in the room dispensed water with a chalky color, so we didn't bother using it. The furniture was the very minimum. I didn't mind the aesthetics of the room, but the mattress (supposedly a double, but seemed like a single with two pillows) was so old that we practically sank into it. It was nearly floor-level when both of us layed on it. The sheets were bare, and we were cold at night, but that was alleviated by wearing sweatshirts to bed.
