The radiator worked, but went on at sporradic intervals. The bathroom was a different story. The shower was clogged, so within three minutes of being in it the water was up to my shins. I only showered twice on a five-day trip because it was such an ordeal. Hot water was scarce. The bottom of the tub was full of debris (soap scum, other people's hair, etc.) Quite gross, but you gotta do what you gotta do. Our floor seemed deserted, despite overhearing that the place was fully booked. The residents were quiet, save the hum of some televisions. I did pass by a few open rooms and noticed that many were much nicer than ours. Not all of the rooms in this place were like ours, but then again, not all of them will be like the pictures on the web site, either. It's hit or miss. Be careful and if you can, ask to see your room before you hand over any money. And finally, the neighborhood. I was mildly familiar with Manhattan before the trip, and the neighborhood is in an area called Morningside Heights, which is right below Harlem. During the day it's like any other place, but at night we were several times approaced by people looking for money. There were some shady looking characters hanging out on the streets, which were all but empty once the sun went down. It's not too dangerous, but if you are coming back to the place after a night out, I recommend taking the subway to 103 and Central Park West and then getting a cab for the remaining blocks (only a few bucks). Seems paranoid, but tourists are easy to pick out in a neighborhood like that. Be careful, travel in groups (especially if you're a woman...hate to say it, but it's better to be safe than sorry), try not to dress too "touristy"--(backpacks, visible cameras, etc.). We didn't have any major incidents with the people in the neighborhood, but when the sun goes down it definitely gives off a very creepy vibe. You can make the decision for yourselves based on my review. If you're on a budget, go for it, but if you can afford a better place, I'd spring for it. I woke up with some mysterious bites on my skin on more than one occassion, and now (finally at home), am feeling pretty itchy. Although it could just be paranoia from reading the previous scabies reviews. Happy traveling and enjoy New York!

Reviews.Title: “Do not listen to All bad reviews, These people do not know when to quit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I see this place has been getting some bad reviews, but you get what you paid for, we booked a room for 4 pax $150.00, which was so CHEAP according to big selection of millions of other hotels in the City that are asking for less expensive hotel romm at $450.00 to $850.00. The Hotel itself is OK kind of old but rooms are furnished with basic furniture, colorful rooms and bathrooms are maintained properly clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. 12/05

Reviews.Title: “Everything is True”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I attempted to stay here overnight in Feb 2004 for a birthday celebration/long week-end. Everything the other reviews say is true: the rude staff who speak no english (we had to wait 1/2 hour for somebody to show up at the desk to check us in), the squalid conditions, the brick wall view, the bare lightbulb in the ceiling, the mis-representation on-line. I've stayed in some slummy places on trips accross the US, but this one takes the cake, and invokes an Eastern European dormitory. My personal favourite was two Irish guys drunk in the hallway outside our intended hovel, trying not to puke and pick me up at the same time. What doesn't get mentioned on this site often is the location itself - the hotel would like you to believe this is Upper West Side, when it's actually Morningside Heights with its accompanying reputation. The night we visited there were prostitutes lounging about the entryway, and a couple of very loud and obnoxious parties going on down the street. The attitude of "you get what you pay for" should not really apply here, because I've stayed in boutique hotels for the same price, and this is just a disgrace. We were so appalled with the conditions of the place, we cut our week-end short and drove back to Boston overnight (slightly dangerous, but looking for another hotel at 1 am was not in my plans.) Fortunately, Orbitz (I think that's where I booked it) gave me a full refund after a phone conversation, and told me they've received complaints about it before, and that they would alter the hotel's profile on the site (which had since been done.)

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've seen anywhere in the world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The West Side Inn is as bad as the very worst reviews here portray. I think I can answer why some reviews are only somehwat negative. On my visit, my room was unusable, and I actually left without spending the night or a refund. The walls were filthy. The window was broken. The carpet was so grimy and sticky I hardly wanted to walk on it with my shoes on. The room stank. Unlike the web photos of the rooms, my room had no mirror, no dresser, no art, no headboard and no floor lamp (only a bare flouresecent bulb on the ceiling). And (here's the key to the difference in reviews), unlike some of the photos, my room looked as though it hadn't been updated in a couple of decades. This is in contrast to a room I happened to see on a lower floor which had been remodeled fairly recently. This room was consistent with a one-star hotel. The room had newish furniture, was recently painted, and looked a lot like the hotel web site's photos. So, it's my guess that the hotel only partially remodeled, and that the many horrible reviews are from guests assigned to the old rooms. Trust me, those rooms are worse than words can say. Really. It's worse than your mind can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!! ”
Reviews.Author: AliTee
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel having just landed in New York. The entrance looks ok - chandeliers and a touch of the faded grandeur, but for some reason (a sixth sense) we did not pay for the 7 nights we had booked. Our room was reached by taking a terrifying creaky ride in an ancient lift. We opened our room and a distinct air of gloom descended upon as we saw the miniscule size - grungy, scungy, creaky bunk beds, single table (no shelves, wardrobes, cupboards). There was barely enough room for one person to stand around in. My friend and I are quite hardy types and normally make the best of things but this was just HORRIBLE. Dirty walls, the lock looked like it had been smashed in several times, dirty bedding, fag burns everywhere. The 'bathroom' was equally vile - the toilet appeared to be leaking... The 'kitchen' area appeared to be little more than a place that rats would like - broken cupboards, dirty walls etc. We decided to get out and try to phone somewhere else - as we went to leave the room, the sound of a drunk shouting expletives and (to our perhaps paranoid minds!) calling us ---!. We were actually afraid!! We had to go out and get drunk to even cope with staying there the night. We slept in our clothes to avoid contact with the sheets! Truly disgusting! Should be shut down! Do not go there!!

Reviews.Title: “How bad can it be !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Warning, do not go to this place. On the internet it looks pretty oke, but it is a really dirty place. We had a room, with a bed, no blankets. The shared bathroom was so filty that you came even out more dirty. If you go to NY, spend a bit more money for a better place to stay. Nicole & Bert. The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the budget traveller and not as bad as past reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I searched on the internet for a cheap place to stay for 7 nights in NYC. We saw the West Side Inn had rooms available and was pretty cheap. However, when we looked on trip advisor this place had some really bad reviews and we nearly didn't bother going. I'm glad we did though, as it was absolutely fine for what we needed, a place to sleep and wash that was within easy access to the subway. When we arrived the lift didn't work so we had to carry our bags up about 6 flghts of stairs, through a couple of narrow dark corridors! but the room was fine. We had a double room (which didn't quite have a double bed in it) but it was clean, had a TV with cable and a door that locked (although didn't quite fit the door frame!). The bathrooms were clean and always had toilet roll. We saw no cockroaches and "touch wood" no evidence of scabies but that past review has made me itch!! This place is not the Hilton and you wouldn't take your family here! But if you are looking to see NYC on a budget this is the place for you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived in New York we knew it would be more expensive than probably any other city in America, but when we got to the West Side Inn we realised we were paying well over the odds for what can only be considered as extremely unsatisfactory and unsanitary. Fair enough, we weren't expecting the Ritz but a basic hostel costing around $30 a night would have outshone this place costing a staggering $100 a night! To be fair the staff were all friendly and helpful to an extent but this was no sort of compensation! For a start the lift was broken so getting our bags up from the basement on the day we left was a nightmare, having to drag them through back allies and over bags and bags of rubbish and up loads of stairs was the last thing you wanted after an exhausting stay in New York! There was no safes in the room, which you wouldn't expect except for the fact that the doors wouldn't even shut properly, not something I would ever consider safe and secure! The window wouldn't shut either! The room hadn't been cleaned properly before we'd arrived, remains of broken glasses and scraps of paper were left under the bed which was supposed to be a double but was practically a roomy single! The towels had dodgy brown stains on them and the bathrooms were crawling with ants! Our rooms weren't cleaned throughout our stay and most of the channels on the tv were fuzzy! Even though the West Side Inn wasn't the best, it was still an experience and once you've stopped crying you will just end up laughing! At the end of the day it's in a great location and seems to attract a young friendly crowd (or skint travellers as we were!) so I'll give the West Side Inn some credit for that!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location. Scabies unacceptable.”
Reviews.Author: Peppin
Reviews.Content: We knew that we picked out a budget hotel, but we figured that it would be fine as we would just be sleeping/bathing there. We pretty much expected that the bed would touch 3 walls (which was pretty much true). We liked the location a lot. It was right by the subway and lots of yummy restaurants and bakeries. However, when we got to West Side Inn, we discovered many problems such as: filthy, itchy linens, 1 small, frayed rather dirty towel, door didn't close all the way, halls smelled of urine, bathrooms were often overflowed and dirty. The website stated they offered am/fm alarm clocks, so I didn't bother to pack our travel alarm clock. Needless to say, the alarm clock was already checked out by the time we got there. But the very nice man who worked at the front desk offered us a wake up bang on the door. We were quite doubtful that he'd remember, but he did! We tried to make the best of things by using the window ledge as a refrigerator for our left-over snacks, and it worked really well. The very worst thing that happened to us was that we both got scabies! We never had those before we stayed at the West Side Inn, but they're really rather unpleasantly itchy. Getting scabies was a memorable souvenir of our time at the West Side Inn. We loved New York, despite our unfortunate pick of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just like my title is what best describes this hotel. You do get what you pay for. The staff is friendly and accomodating, but the hotel is definitely not the best. The rooms are drabby, beds are hard, and for lack of a better word, it is so Ghetto there. Do not expect your beds to be made or be given fresh towels. The bathrooms were kept clean most of the time, but there are definitely some plumbling issues and the tubs are not the best. Paint is chipping away all over the place. Overall, it is okay and if you are looking to save money this is your place. The area is quite safe, lots of great markets, and shops. Close to the subway and the food around there is excellent. Great location. The pictures on www.westsideinn.com are quite deceiving and false. There are no decorations and it is not as nice as it appears on line. Be careful and read the reviews first on all New York Hotels because what seems too good to be true probably is.

Reviews.Title: “just laugh it off.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had been planning our trip to NYC for almost a year. We were very low on cash but still wanted to have an awesome trip, so we decided to book our 8 nights stay at the West Side Inn, off of Expedia. I will admit that we got what we had paid for (small rooms, chipping paint, old TV, etc.), but all these features are the charm of this hotel. After our first couple of nights, we learned to laugh about the problems of the rooms and bathrooms, the questionable elevator and how our lights never turned on right when you flicked the switch (the first time it happened we thought for sure the lights didn't work). Honestly, it's not as bad as everyone on here is making it out to be; the staff was friendly, the carpets may have been stained a little but the room was clean and the bathroom was always kept clean and well stocked with toilet paper, the location is awesome (subway only 2 minutes away, and much cheaper than taking a cab), the neighbourhood is NOT scary but quite friendly, and the restaurants in the area are to die for (Famous Famiglia has the best pizza I have ever eaten). Just don't expect a 5 star hotel when staying here. Laugh it off just as we did. It sure makes some interesting stories to tell your friends and family when you get back home.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than worst in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worse than worst hotel in Turkey. My wife and I honeymooned in Turkey. We went with a tour group - meaning we stayed in some pretty cheap places. I can honestly say that the worst hotel we stayed at in Turkey was better than the Westside Inn. Do yourself a favor and stay at an airport hotel in Newark. We decided to cut our losses, stay at an airport hotel - boy were we glad. If I had to do it all over again, I would have stayed at the Hilton near Penn Station in Newark - perfect place to get to Manhattan quickly and probably isn't too much considering it is not in NYC. Beware, the pictures on the website are deceiving. They do not portray rust, chipping paint, smoke smells, street noises, no room service, wet towels, and unsanitary bathroom conditions. You can see how they used unique angles once you are in the hotel to get their pictures. If you do decide to stay, please look at the rooms before you pay. The fact that they don't accept credit cards should have been one clue. The staff does not speak or understand English too well. When I asked whether they had queen beds, I was told "1 bed for 2 people." The bed the man was referring to was a full size bed. I would also bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value! Don't listen to the review's that say this place is dirty!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel23
Reviews.Content: I almost cancelled our reservations here because of the reviews that it was filthy, thankfully I didn't becauseit it was not. It's certaintly not luxury, so don't expect that. The rooms are very small, the elevator didn't always work, and we a few problems with the shower getting hot then cold then hot, but we spend little time in our room and it's a great value. Very close to the subway and Columbia U., North Central Park, Museum of Natural History, great rest, etc.. There are other budget hotels in town, but this one I can vouch wasn't bad!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel does appear to be getting a bit of a bad reputation! I am not going to tell you that this hotel is amazing but what you get is what you pay for! The room is interesting! You walk in and can almost touch both walls with your arms out stretched. The only furniture is a bunk bed and TV. The bunk bed is not the most comfortable but is adequate. The bed is quite noisy especially when moving around at night! The TV quite suprisingly has cable and has a majority of the decent channels! The shared bathroom always seemed clean and the shower provided was powerful enough to have a decent shower! Although the toilet did block up on one day! The staff seem friendly at reception and my favourite part of the hotel is the lift which appears to be marble until you get near it and the marble effect is little more than stuck on panels! The location appears to be pleasent with many shops around. The subway is a 5 minute walk away, you can either join the Number 1 line at 103rd or 110th. The pictures are slightly misleading as they make the hotel look like a quaint Paris style hotel, this is not the case. Please do not have high expectations of this place because you will be bitterly disapointed! It is basic but you should only be paying roughly $60 - $70 a night for two!

Reviews.Title: “West Side a disgrace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like many of the guests who frequented this hotel, I found my visit very unpleasant. As a regular student traveller, I am used to 'roughing' it but have not once stayed in a location that I found to be so revolting. I visited with my mother in late October of last year. We were directed to one of the 'best' bedrooms which we found to be without a light, had a rickety double bed, filthy carpet, dirty bedsheets and a single blanket. The communal bathroom was extremely dirty with used sanitary products littering the floor and a blocked toilet. The corridors smelt of urine though attempts had been made to eliminate the smell with a white powder. We were so disgusted with the hotel that we tried in vain to find vacancies at other lodgings. I was not expecting the 'Ritz' at the prices we were paying but I do believe that there are minimum standards of cleanliness that should be met. I think I'll go for the youth hostel next time...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap, but old, dark, dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Westside Inn's best features are a cheap price and a nice neighborhood. My daughter and I walked to Columbia - enjoying a good $4 breakfast in a working class diner. The restaurants in the area (including the cafe featured in Seinfeld) and proximity to the subway and Central Park almost make up for the WSI's unhelpful staff, dingy hallways and dirty carpets. The other guests were on a budget like us and we commiserated with each other. Yes, it is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in but we still had a great time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCapital
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the West Side Inn for 3 nights in February and couldn't have been happier. The location was good for the price and the rooms were adequate. The bathrooms were always clean and the rooms, excluding the comforter, were also clean. A note: I would be more hesitant to come to this hotel in hotter months i.e. July. In February, most bugs and whatnot are dead. Anyway, we each paid $33.00 CND (about $25US) per night and couldn't have been happier. This is not a first class hotel but it excellent for the budget traveller who just wants a place to spend the night and will spend the rest of their time exploring the city. To put it in perspective, we were forced to spend the last night of our trip at the Pan American because the West Side Inn was fully booked on the last night. I would much rather have spent the fourth night at the West Side Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Worst of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: solonavigator
Reviews.Content: Don't believe any of the pictures. In 30 years of travel this is the worst place I've ever stayed in, and that includes hotels in Africa. The tiny room had one creaking bunk bed that looked and felt like it had been picked up from a junkyard - no other furniture. The bathrooms down the hall are dirty, unsanitary and unkempt. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Reservation Fraud”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't ever, ever, ever make a reservation with this hotel. I booked an online reservation with cheaptickets (dot com), as a package deal with my flight. The morning I was supposed to leave, I thought I should call the hotel just to confirm my reservations and make sure everything went through ok- It was a good thing I did, becuase the man on the phone acted like he didn't know what I was talking about, said I had no reservation, and that I needed to call cheaptickets to call them with my confirmation number- I was still on the line when the agent from cheaptickets spoke to the same man, and the man at the desk proceeded to tell him that I was trying to cancel my reservation, which was an obvious lie, and fraud on thier part. Had I gone to that hotel, I would have been told that I still had no reservation, or that cheaptickets had cancelled it, and they probably would have told me if I wanted a room, I would have to pay more money. I also do not recommmend cheaptickets, because they stood behind this fraudulant hotel that they do business with, and I did not receive my money back. I am in the process of reporting them both to the Better Business Bureau.

Reviews.Title: “Unsanitary, dangerous, unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No-one expects luxury from a lower-priced hotel, but the West Side Inn lies about the ameneties it offers, posts misleading pictures on its web site, and ultimately is NOT all that cheap (I paid nearly $100 a night). I've stayed in plenty of budget hotels and hostels, most of which offered basic ameneties but were clean and friendly. The WSI is filthy, smells like stale sweat and urine throughout, unsafe (doors don't close properly, no emergency lighting, no fire detection, one stairway, poor lighting, mentally unstable permanent guests, etc.). It presumably makes its money through non-refunded cancellations. Please look at my pictures to see what it really looks like.

Reviews.Title: “Hell has got to be better than this one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST hotel, no, the WORST place I have ever been in. The rooms were filthy, the neighborhood questionable, the building looked like it was going to fall on top of you, the staff were unkind and tried to swindle me of another $70 for having checked out 10 minutes late. I was told that otherwise I would be charged an extra day by (---). That was a lie. I would NEVER EVER stay in this filthy place and I hope to God none of you ever will.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints, it was perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what these people who wrote reviews were expecting when they booked the cheapest hotel in Manhattan. If you want the Ritz, then go there. I expected a cheap, clean, adequate place to stay for a couple days and that's exactly what I received. Staff was friendly and there were no problems with our reservation. Contrary to a few reports on here, they did take accept the credit card payment we had made online to book the room. The room was spacious with high ceilings and clean beds. Blankets were thin but extras were available. We were right across from the bathroom which was spotless and we never had to wait. The carpet was filthy, the "kitchen" consisted of a room with a sink, and it was not warm enough for a January night, but other than that I have no complaints. On an extremely tight budget, as we were, I'd go there again.

Reviews.Title: “West Side Inn Great for budget Travel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel very last minute for a last minute getaway over the weekend of 12/11/04. After I booked the hotel due to rooms being very limited because of the busy holiday season approaching, I read the reviews of West Side and was mortified. I immediatly started to find something else, but everything was booked. We finally arrived at the west side inn and found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. They were very much wanting to make our stay comfortable. We were taken to our room which was on the fourth floor. The room was small and there was paint that was peeled off the wall, but there was a TV, a bed, and a window. What more do you want when you are going to be out seeing the city all day long. It did take a little coaching for myself to use the shared bath, but it was not that bad at all. Everyone was very respectful about not taking too long in the showers and making sure they left the bathroom decent when they were finished. The hotel is in an awesome location. It is a 2 min walk from the 1 and 9 train and there is also a nice pub just around the corner. The upper west side is beautiful, and West Side Inn is right in the center of it. If you are looking for an inexpensive room just to lay your head for a few hours before heading out again to see the city then west side is a great hotel for your stay. Why pay more for just a bed elsewhere when you can stay at west side.

Reviews.Title: “I read the reviews, made a reservation anyway: it was fine!”
Reviews.Author: ramblingstone
Reviews.Content: If you intend to make your hotel a featureded part of your stay this is NOT the hotel for you. But New York City was the attraction for us (two women) and we found this hotel to be just fine. All we wanted was a centrally located, safe, decent place to sleep and wash and the West Side Inn fit the bill. Yes, the hotel is rundown, but the price was unbeatable; the location perfect -- in a residential neighbourhood that was interesting and safe, very convenient to the subway and when we came home late at night the streets were quiet but not creepily deserted; the nearby cafes, bakeries and restaurants were terrific, frequented by locals and regulars with good food reasonably priced; the room was warm (we were there in December); the beds were comfy; the carpet was shocking (bring slippers); but the bed linen and towels were clean; the blankets, though thin, were clean and more were available from the front desk; the washroom down the hall was clean with lots of hot water; there was no closet or bureau in the room (a row of hooks would be a welcome addition); there was no phone in the room just in the lobby; but the tv worked and so did the lift; there was no daily room service during the 5-night stay we were there, but the front desk staff were very friendly and the other guests were budget travellers of all ages. It is a quiet hotel. If you want a better grade of accomodation, face it, you need to be prepared to spend more money! But if you want to save that money so you can spend it on enjoying NY, don't be afraid to stay at the West Side Inn.

Reviews.Title: “One of the low points of my life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was as bad as they say. We arrived at 12:30 to find that they had given our room away. We were supposed to have a room with a double bed. We had signed up for late check in and nothing on the material we recieved from Expedia said anything about a 12AM deadline. The people at the front desk were unapologetic and said the only way to get a refund was to speak to a manager the next day at 8:00 am. So we huddled together, with our clothes on and the lights on for fear of bugs and germs on the bottom of a little bunkbed. It was horrible. Horrible. I cried all night. One of the low points of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe and scary and lets not forget dirty!”
Reviews.Author: ali132
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and thought it cant be that bad, now i really wish i had took them in, we just thought oh well its cheap and the pictures dont look that bad! the reception wasnt to bad but the hotel was like 70 blocks from times square which cost us $12 in a taxi whenever we wanted to get back to the hotel from hell! yeah as i was saying the reception was fine the lift ok then we got out and oh my god it was like something from the shining dark and scary! we found our room and couldnt even get in the door was jammed and it even had a big crack in the top not safe at all we eventually got in to find a room with a bed oh and lets not forget the stained carpet and sheets!yuk! we then went to check out the bathroom it was flooded and smelt and there were hairs all over the place taps dirty aswell as the sink and floor. me and my friend had to go to the bathroom together as we were scared of getting killed or something! we didnt even attempt to have a shower we had to stay there 3 nights until another hotel was sorted out for us and god did the new hotel feel like the ritz! dont stop there whatever you do unless your a tramp!

Reviews.Title: “For the love of God- don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: gillbug
Reviews.Content: After staying at this abode, I now know what it's like on a Cagney 'n' Lacey TV set. Imagine the scene: a bedroom with a broken window, rickety beds, moth eaten carpet, and beaten-in door, taken over for forensic investigation! My friend and I hoped for cheap digs to save costs; somewhere to rest our heads and shower, while we sampled the delights of NYC....BUT.. The room was a blatant single, into which the proprietors managed to stuff an extra bed. For five nights, our routine involved arising at 7am to be first in the shared showers (hot water ran out by 8) ; no space to swing our hair let alone a cat; constant complainting about overflowing toilets; returning home late demoralised by our accommadation. IN SHORT- the Upper West location is great, but this is a HOSTEL. Unless you're a backpacker (hence, high level tolerance for all things remotely cheap), forget this place. Find a hotel with your own bathroom- it will have more room to breathe, and at least some closet/wardrobe space. This place totally affected the experience of staying in NYC, and anything that can do that, is NOT recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Believe everything you read re: West Side Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s all true. The worst thing about the West Side Inn besides the filth and dirty linenâ€™s is the fact that they donâ€™t tell you on their website that they do not take credit cards. When you reserve a room over the Internet it asks for Credit card information. However, when you arrive, late at night, you are informed that they need cash. Our visit was for 4 days starting Oct 8, 2004 on the 5th floor. We argued and insisted that it would have been nice to know ahead of time about not taking credit cards. They must own that ATM machine at the front desk that forces you to get more cash at the cost of $1.75. That place is a rip-off at $100. per night for a bunk bed and smelly rooms, plus people are allowed to smoke anywhere they please. On or about the 2nd and 3rd floors, it smelled so bad, like some drunk urinated all the way down the halls. Nasty place!

Reviews.Title: “tell your worst enemy to stay at the West Side Inn”
Reviews.Author: savoyfan
Reviews.Content: The website for the West Side Inn looks inviting, but this is the worst place imagineable. Upon arriving and having guaranteed our reservations with a credit card, we were informed that they don't take credit cards, just cash. Nice of them to mention it - it would have been nice if they had told us in advance. Nothing about that either on their website, or when I called them in person to confirm our reservation (which they didn't have, so we had to fix that over the phone, too). The room was sheer crap - 15 coats of paint over every moving part of the door, cracks and holes in the wall, nothing in the room except a bed, table, TV, light switch, and ceiling light. No wastepaper basket, closet, closet hooks, soap, shampoo, maid service, coat hangers, or anything else you could imagine; nothing except smelly towels, dirty rugs, smelly halls, a "complete kitchen" consisting of a room down the hall with a sink and faucet. If you have out of town guests, under no circumstances advise them of this horrendous excuse of a hotel. I was envious of Martha Stewart's new digs the whole time we were there. P.S. the same people run West End Studios, too.

Reviews.Title: “Lowered expectations, but hey it's cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes it is dingy, yes the service is minimal, but it's the cheapest game in town and I didn't go to NYC to stay in a room. It's close to the subway, in a reasonably safe neighborhood and I could lock the door. The bathrooms were in high demand but were cleaned twice a day by my recollection. The bed was sagging and the only light in the room was a glaring flourescent fixture, but I only used the place to hang my hat and crash a few hours here and there. If I expected a resort, an all-inclusive or a four star, I sure wouldn't have expected to get it for $55. Live and learn. I would stay again if money is tight because the next step up in town is easily triple the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously- Don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a cheap place to stay (whilst we were on our honeymoon, no less!), and happened upon the West Side Inn on an on-line travel agent site. We were happy with the price and the pictures looked good, so we booked it. A couple of weeks before we were due to fly out, we happened upon this website. We were both pretty freaked out, and we did consider cancelling, but then we looked at the official West Side Inn website. It looked fine, and we figured that maybe people were over reacting- BIG MISTAKE!! When we got there we were told that the lift to our floor didn't work, so having lugged our cases up to the room, we were in for a nasty shock. The carpet was stained, there were no sheets on the bed, the room was tiny, and the door didn't even shut properly. We walked straight back out, and were told by the jobsworth on reception that even though we had only given our details over five minutes before, we could not have the piece of paper with them on back. Why? Well apparently he doesn't make the rules so he couldn't tell us. The moral of the story is, although I'm sure that none of you would be naive enough to book this for your honeymoon, if you really must go there, please only pay for one night so that you don't end up battling to get your money back. It really is that bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the West Side Inn in late 2002, and I wish I had read the reviews on this website back then. The West Side Inn is by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. It was so bad, I don't even know where to begin -- it was like the stereotypical flophouse/hellhole motel out of a movie. It was filthy, crowded, and completely uncomfortable. As a woman, if I hadn't been traveling with a man, I'd have been afraid there. I've stayed at hostels and cheap B&Bs across Europe, and all of them were 4 stars compared to this place. I wouldn't pay anything to stay here -- but charging $100 a night for this place should be criminal. Stay away -- spend $20 dollars more a night and get a real hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Hell noun 1) Home of the ----- after death 2) a place or state of misery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Its so good to here that as many people also suffered at the hands of the west side inn. We were there for 7 whole nights! Dont belive the official website and if you haven't seen it yet have a look, as its good for a laugh. The West Side inn is possibly the worst, no THE worst place on earth. It is a flea pit with dirty sheets, dirty rooms and dirty bathrooms. We were promised a fridge, a promise the unintelligible owner had no problem in breaking. Justice was served we feel when one of our friends accidentally tripped over and formed a hole in the wall the size of the empire state building. The West side in is literally falling to pieces!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NorthWalian24
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at. As I was on a budget trip for 3 weeks in 2002, I booked a hotel for the first night after a long flight. When I arrived with my backpack at the hotel I was made to wait 45 minutes at reception, even though the place wasn't even busy!! I had booked the room for almost $80 for one night. I was given the key and had to barge the door open because it was so stiff. When I finally got in to the room, I was faced with one bed, 4 walls and a window facing another big wall. For $80 I was expecting a slightly bigger room, a tv and at least a bed side table. I got nothing. It was worse than a really bad hostel. I went to the reception and enquired about the room in a polite manner. The reaction from the guy at the reception was: "Jesus, what do you want to do, get married in your room?". I decided I would bite my tongue and spend the night there. Because it was a very humid night I got very little sleep because of the lack of air conditioning and when I woke up in the morning to take a shower, I might as well have walked into a gas chamber. IT REALLY WAS THAT BAD. I urge you not to stay at this hotel. You can find a decent budget hotel in this beautiful and amazing city. STAYING AT THIS HOTEL WILL RUIN YOUR TRIP. Don't give them the satisfaction!!

HotelInfo.Name: West Side Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 237 West 107th Street, New York City, NY 10025
